subclassFeature.name: Gloating Monologue
entries: {@note Modified version of the original anime swordsman by Turk.}

When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, as a Bonus action on your turn you can loudly and deliberately make a long-winded monologue aimed at a creature explaining exactly how you've just gained the upper hand and have been holding back in some ridiculous and obscure way. Make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) or ({@skill Performance}) check contested by the target's passive Wisdom ({@skill Insight}). If you succeed, you have advantage on the next melee attack you make against the target creature on this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Haunted Yet Convenient Past
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Performance} (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Improved Haunted Yet Convenient Past
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Performance} (your choice). If you are already proficient, gain expertise in that skill instead.

subclassFeature.name: This Isn't Even My Final Form
entries: At 7th level, you unlock an even higher form of power. As an action on your turn you may transform, gaining the following benefits for the next minute:

This transformation becomes more powerful the longer you go without using it. For each round you don't transform in combat, you gain a stacking +1 modifier to attack and damage rolls up to a maximum of +3. Additionally, you may make one melee attack as part of the transformation action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Why Do I Hear Boss Music?
entries: Starting at 10th level. If you drop to 0 Hit Points and don't die outright, you can make a {@dc 10} {@skill Performance} or {@skill Intimidation} check. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead as your dramatic theme song fills the air.
Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}, the DC resets to 10.

subclassFeature.name: Unlocked Potential
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain a climbing speed equal to your current walking speed. This benefit works even when moving up or across completely flat, smooth surfaces, but only in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn on or against a surface and nothing else is holding you aloft. Additionally, your transformation now grants you a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and the stacking modifier no longer has a limit.

subclassFeature.name: You're Already Dead
entries: Starting at 18th level, you have learned an {@s bullshit} ancient technique passed down through the generations. As an action, you can move up to your speed, without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}, and when you move within 5 feet of any other creature during this action, you may mark them with your blade. A creature can only be marked once whenever you take this action.

At the end of your turn, all creatures marked this way must make a Constitution saving throw. (DC is 8 + proficiency + charisma modifier). Those who fail are reduced to 0 hit points, those who succeed take 10x your weapon damage.
Once you use this feature, you must complete a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest} before you can use it again.
